p: This study could open a new field of application for controlled HC processes, with potential for practical developments, due to high efficacy, energy and resource use efficiency, as well as straightforward scalability. These properties were the main drivers of several recent and successful implementations of HC processes at the pilot and industrial scale, e.g., in the fields of water heating [ 53], beer-brewing [ 20, 22], wastewater remediation [ 27], pretreatment of biomasses [ 54], and enhancement of biochar properties [ 36]. The same properties were considered essential for bridging the gap from the pilot to the industrial scale in the food field, such as in the extraction of bioactive compounds [ 18, 55], including from fruits [ 56], and cereals [ 57], as well as in food pasteurization and sterilization [ 18, 58], and in the creation of stable oil-in-water nanoemulsions [ 18].
